thread.title: Russia to target MERKEL? Putin builds model of GERMAN PARLIAMENT for military training
thread.title_full: Russia to target MERKEL? Putin builds model of GERMAN PARLIAMENT for military training

title: Russia to target MERKEL? Putin builds model of GERMAN PARLIAMENT for military training
text:
REUTERS 1 of 50 Russian Marines show their individual combat skills during a public capability demonstration at the Luneta National Park in Metro Manila We are building a replica of the Reichstag in Patriot Park. Not a full-sized one, but something that allows the Young Army to storm a specific target Sergei Shoigu 
Children as young as 10 are able to sign up to the group to learn how to handle weapons, engage in military training and encourage patriotic fervour among Russians. 
When launched in 2015, Shoigu claimed it marked a "revival of the good old tradition of children's and youth organisations". 
Shoigu said: “We are building a replica of the Reichstag in Patriot Park. Not a full-sized one, but something that allows the Young Army to storm a specific target, not just any old place.” 
He added he wanted to "take over the training of youth in the spirit of patriotism, ideals of friendship and internationalism”. GETTY Russia annexed the Crimea in 2014 
The Reichstag is still used to German politicians to this day after a series of renovations. 
Putin launched his annexation of Crimea in 2014 and there are fears the Russian leader could be using soft power to increase his sphere of influence across the globe. 
Russia has been accused of hacking the Democratic National Convention and working with WikiLeaks to affect the result of the US election. Related articles
